p: Emerging Infectious Diseases (EID) and spreading of diseases, and vulnerability to pandemics and disease outbreaks have been increasing locally and globally during the last few decades (Lindahletal., 2015). An EID, by definition is “a disease which has a tendency to spread geographically; cause an increased incidence of disease, or infect a new species or new populations; or is a disease spreading within any host population” [ [1], [2], [3], [4]]. The increasing risks of exposure, increases in the number of susceptible individuals, and the infectiousness of the infected individual are the parameters that must be considered in assessing the risks of an EID.
